Occam's razor is a heuristic for pruning a solution set

Last updated on June 1, 2021

In general, Occam’s razor is a heuristic for pruning a set of candidate solutions to a certain search problem. Concretely, when trying to approximate a natural phenomenon with a dynamical system, Occam’s razor is used to select the minimal system which explains a certain behavior.
